metadata.name: A Picture of the Future 1/100
metadata.description:
I used to wonder what a complex future we would have, now I condemn the simple queries that will define it for us. I'm not anti-AI, I'm simply scared of the unethical uses and social repercussions from increased use and surplus application of it. Things like willingness and making hard to make hard choices, limiting creativity, complacency, laziness, AI bias and lessened social progression will follow an incautious approach to AI use. I offer this "picture" as a reference for a case where AI heavily limits us and nearly dehumanizes human interaction. 

After all, Einstein says, "I fear the day when the technology overlaps with our humanity. The world will only have a generation of idiots."

This piece specifically is about the dehumanization if interaction through surplus use of AI. I wanted to make a statement about where I think AI leads us in both creating the piece and the subject matter.
